__NOTOC__ ===How do I have only shortcut keys for an action?===
The '''New Action''' wizard allows you to uncheck both menu and toolbar placement for your action and only assign a keyboard shortcut. To learn how to do this manually, read on. Refer to [[TaT_HackingNetBeansXMLLayerPartOne | TaT_HackingNetBeansXMLLayerPartOne]] for more details.
====Trick #1==== * Retain the action's basic registration: <source lang="xml"> <folder name="Actions"> <folder name="Tools"> <file name="org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.instance"/> </folder> </folder> </source> * This registers an action as a '''Global Menu Item''': <source lang="xml"> <folder name="Menu"> <folder name="Tools"> <file name="org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.shadow"> <attr name="originalFile" stringvalue="Actions/Tools/org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.instance"/> <attr name="position" intvalue="150"/> </file> </folder> </folder> </source> * This registers an action as a '''Global Toolbar Button''': <source lang="xml"> <folder name="Toolbars"> <folder name="Build"> <file name="org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.shadow"> <attr name="originalFile" stringvalue="Actions/Tools/org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.instance"/> <attr name="position" intvalue="325"/> </file> </folder> </folder> </source> * To assign a shortcut key, replace either or both of them with something like the following: <source lang="xml"> <folder name="Shortcuts"> <file name="O-F3.shadow"> <attr name="originalFile" stringvalue="Actions/Tools/org-nvarun-tat-SayCheez.instance"/> </file> </folder> </source>
====Trick #2==== * In the above example the action has the shortcut key '''Alt+F3''', which is represented as <tt>O-F3</tt>. In general, if you have some key combination that uses '''Alt''' (or the equivalent on Mac OS X), then use <tt>O</tt>. Separate modifiers from the base keycode name with <tt>-</tt>, and append <tt>.shadow</tt> for the filename. '''Ctrl''' (or its Mac equivalent) is represented by <tt>D</tt>, and '''Shift'''by <tt>S</tt>. (<tt>C</tt> and <tt>A</tt> represent the literal '''Ctrl''' and '''Alt''' keys, but this is less portable.)
====Tips to Remember==== # Following are some keycode equivalents. See Javadoc for <tt>KeyEvent</tt> for the full list: :* '''A''' to '''Z''' (as is), '''F1''' to '''F12''' (as is), '''0''' to '''9''' (as is) :* '''/''' as <tt>SLASH</tt>, '''\''' as <tt>BACK_SLASH</tt> :* ''';''' as <tt>SEMI_COLON</tt> :* '''.''' as <tt>PERIOD</tt> :* '''â€˜''' as <tt>QUOTE</tt>
See also [[DevFaqKeybindings | DevFaqKeybindings]].
(Reposted from [http://netbeans.dzone.com/tips/play-with-xml-layer this entry on NetBeans Zone].)
